title: Peer-to-peer lenders warned not to 'put profits over investors'
text:
Peer-to-peer firms have been cautioned by the City watchdog, amid fears that platforms are playing down the risks to investors and concerns that some are struggling to comply with impending new regulations.

The Financial Conduct Authority first warned in 2018 that some firms were offering investments unsuitable to ordinary savers, had unreliable performance and offered returns which were too small given the risks involved.

It has devised new rules for the sector – taking effect on Dec 9 – but there are now fears that some platforms may find themselves unable to meet the more rigorous rules.
